meanings.definition: To make a harsh grinding or scraping noise.
meanings.sent1: The rusty gate began to gride as it swung open.
meanings.sent2: The old gears in the machine started to gride loudly.
meanings.sent3: The car brakes decided to gride in protest of the sudden stop.
meanings.sent4: The metal on metal contact made the sound of gride echo through the room.
meanings.sent5: The grating noise of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.

meanings.definition: To cause to grind or grate together.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally made the two metal pieces gride against each other.
meanings.sent2: The chef used the mortar and pestle to gride the spices together.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully tried to gride their toys together in a pretend battle.
meanings.sent4: The friction between the two surfaces caused them to gride against each other.
meanings.sent5: The gears were carefully aligned to gride smoothly without any resistance.
